channel.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
channel.description:
[s]Well the last time I made a thread like this, I ended up not moving. This time I hope to move to Australia in a few days.
Budget: $2000 Website: www.pccasegear.com
$129 Case: CM 690 II Advanced with Window $329 Processor: i7 2600 $199 Mobo: ASUS P8P67 Motherboard $165 Ram:Corsair CMP6GX3M3A1600C8 6GB (3x2GB) DDR3 - lol I don't even know what this is but w/e $699 Video card: EVGA GeForce GTX 580 $249 Monitor: Samsung BX2440 24inch http://www.pccasegear.com/index.php?main_page=product_info&products_id=14736 $19 Keyboard + Mouse: Gigabyte KM6150 Multimedia USB Keyboard and Mouse $99 HDD: Western Digital Caviar Black 1TB SATAIII $29 DVD: Lite-On IHAS524 24x DVDRW Super AllWrite $102 PSU: Antec EarthWatts 650W $119 mitb's fave: Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium 64bit OEM
Total: $2138 therefore I might downgrade from the gtx 580.
Ggogogogogogogogogogogogogogo[/s]
[size=36pt]Is benQ a decent monitor brand?[/size] The bx2440 I wanted is out of stock

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Speljohan:

According to most reviews etc, BenQ monitors are really good for their low price.

Thanks. That was all I wanted to hear. Tommorow morning I’m going to update my order and hopefully the rest of the parts will be here in a few days.

Read full topic

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[size=36pt]Is benQ a decent monitor brand?[/size] The bx2440 I wanted is out of stock.

I’ve bought all the parts and right now I’m just waiting for the case and monitor. The monitor I wanted is out of stock so I need to change it. I’m considering changing to http://www.pccasegear.com/index.php?main_page=product_info&cPath=558_1090&products_id=14386 except I don’t know if I should trust benQ. The rest of the parts are sitting at home in my room waiting to be built.

Read full topic

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

the new i7 series models with the ‘k’ on the end are the good ones, you could say the ones without the k on the end are locked down a fair amount.

Read full topic

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

cumescape:

xEnt, the new Sandy Bridge i7’s have a built in kill switch…

ummm no they don’t?

Honestly people hear it has drm on it and go mental. The new sandy bridge processors are amazing

Read full topic

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m positive there are plenty of stores that sells the ‘older’ cards. (how old are they? a few months max?)

Read full topic

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Wow, that video card is more than I usually spend on an entire computer. You should probably instead get 2 480s, it would be cheaper and faster.

I would except I don’t know of a store in Australia that sells the older cards. You guys in the USA are very lucky when it comes to building computers…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:5, topic:377986”]xEnt, the new Sandy Bridge i7’s have a built in kill switch…

Radeon, IMB Model M from a thrift store, cheap as hell and great quality :3[/quote]

Couldn’t find it at PCCG. This looks decent http://www.pccasegear.com/index.php?main_page=product_info&products_id=15324

What’s this kill switch thing?

xEnt:

get an i7 2600, the new i7’s are out at PCCG. find whatever socket 1155 mobo suits you, grab 1 GTX580 or 2 6950’s and unlock them to 6970s. CM 690 II advanced is a great case, not too loud either. get a 60gb sandforce ssd too.

Didn’t know there were new i7s w00t. I want to get an ssd but only when there’s sata 3s. If it fits my budget I’ll get a single 580, otherwise ill get a 6970 or a 570.

Need some decent 6gb DDR 3 ram suggestions.

Read full topic

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

xEnt, the new Sandy Bridge i7’s have a built in kill switch…

item.description:

get an i7 2600, the new i7’s are out at PCCG. find whatever socket 1155 mobo suits you, grab 1 GTX580 or 2 6950’s and unlock them to 6970s. CM 690 II advanced is a great case, not too loud either. get a 60gb sandforce ssd too.

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:2, topic:377986”]Generic Keyboard and Mouse, no need to have them riced up.

For your Video card wait for the GTX560’s in February and get 2 of them, unless you have enough left over money get ~2 580’s.[/quote]

Well tbh I’m not that interested in 1080p, I might even get a smaller monitor. I prefer not to SLI as I don’t want a 99999W PSU. One 580 or even something lower will suffice.

I agree with what you say about the keyboard. Any particular model in mind though? Some can be really shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Building desktop. Edit: BenQ?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

Generic Keyboard and Mouse, no need to have them riced up.

For your Video card wait for the GTX560’s in February and get 2 of them, unless you have enough left over money get ~2 580’s.

[s]Well the last time I made a thread like this, I ended up not moving. This time I hope to move to Australia in a few days.

Budget: $2000

$329 Processor: i7 2600

$29 DVD: Lite-On IHAS524 24x DVDRW Super AllWrite
